comment:
Jesus Christ Saves

Jesus Christ, the Son of God, is returning very soon, and is the reason for all of the things that are happening on the Earth right now. This planet is on borrowed time.

Jesus Christ died on the cross, was buried in a tomb, and rose from the dead 3 days later to pay for the sins of mankind to give us eternal life and forgiveness from God.

EXACTLY how to be Saved by Jesus Christ, the Son of God:

1. Confess with your mouth that Jesus Christ is Lord.
2. Believe in your heart that God has raised Jesus Christ from the dead.

Biblical References:
1. Romans 5:9
2. Romans 3:23
3. Romans 6:23
4. Romans 10:9
5. Romans 10:13
6. Ephesians 2: 8 & 9
7. John 3:16

God bless you, peace be with you always. Thank you for your time.

author: Ze-LuJ

comment:
"You & I (Nobody In The World)"

In the music video we see a collection of beautiful people who think theyre not, they do everything they can to modify themselves to fit a false sense of beauty, because beauty is not defined. They pierce their ears (4:32) put on makeup, workout, do their hair, wear jewelry, think there body types are wrong, and in general, are dissatisfied w themselves, they get home or to their locker and want to break down because they dont want to do it, they dont want to change, it brings them literal pain and it fucking sucks and its so sad. Everyone is beautiful, but they believe they are not because its defined, and dont give themselves permission to be them, and to be happy, and know that they are beautiful just the way they are, towards the end of the video you see this become a reality, they accept themselves and others accept them, and their faces light up and they believe they are beautiful as they should and its so beautiful to see. And it made me cry. Because i always felt it in my soul, that if people would just believe the truth they are beautiful how happy they would be and how much easier their life would be, all the characters seemed to spend all their waking hours trying to be something theyre not (sounds familiar to my story) to get home and look themselves in the mirror and be depressed bc even if someone did love them, it wasnt really them (also my story) and its so FUCKING heartbreaking and it needs to stop.

comment:
Everytime I listen to this song, I start thinking of everyone I've lost. Specifically, I think of my mom. I lost her when I was 4, so I didn't really get the chance to, but sometimes when my brain allows me to have certain flashbacks if my mental state is good**, it occurs to me I don't think she ever really understood or was verbally told enough that she was beautiful. I say verbally cause all the stories I here NOW make her out to be a saint (in a good way), always thinking of and literally putting everyone before herself. And I understand since I do the same thing unconsciously. But I started to realize that's pretty sad because maybe she did it so she COULD feel beautiful, so when'd she ever do something selfish for her? I'm speculating, and she's gone so I'll never really know unless she wrote it somewhere, but I know that I push myself to my absolute limit physically and mentally for others, and I'm honestly not a good person (which I've accepted now in a sad twisted way I suppose), so I can only imagine how she, who was a good person, felt.

Maybe you're like her, and I just want you to know you are loved and you are beautiful whether you realize that or not. I believe her willingness to extend herself so far and so thin was part of the reason she died so young, and I don't want that for anyone else. You ARE beautiful just the way you are. â¤ï¸

**I'm a suicide and an abuse [of all kinds] survivor, as well have Major depression so that's why I worded it that way

comment:
Looking at all these strong, beautiful women makes me feel like all the flaws that Iâ€™ve been worrying about are insignificant. 

    To all my fellow women out there who have been bullied, oppressed, shamed or have been told that youâ€™re ugly or not good enough because of the way you where created, I want you to know that theyâ€™re wrong. Theyâ€™ve ALWAYS BEEN WRONG. Donâ€™t you dare change yourself for some one whoâ€™s opinion is based off what is seen on the surface. 

   Take it from me. I canâ€™t even say the number of times Iâ€™ve been bullied or called ugly, there too many. Honey, you are beautiful. And there is someone out there who will be so amazed be the person you are that they will want to spend the rest of their life looking to you for strength, inspiration and love. God bless youğŸ˜Šâ¤ï¸

Please read this if you have ever felt alone, depressed, suicidal, lost, scared, worthless, abandoned, or anything of that nature, this is for you You Are Beautiful. You Are Wanted. You Are Wonderful. Don't quit on yourself. Don't hurt yourself. You are worth the world and nobody want to see you suffering. This is not the end. The way you feel right now will pass. People's minds will change. Things WILL get better. We love you and are always here for you, Do NOT do something permanent over something temporary. You're better than that, All stars need to see darkness before the light, And always remember, Don't change so people will like you, Be yourself & the right people will find and love the real you. You Matter! no matter what other people may say. Always know this is true. It helps. You are worth my time to write this, I do care, <3 Continue on <3 be a soldier, Fight that war. Because YOU can, I believe in you, I'm rooting for you! Good luck! (and if you want to talk im here to listen, just let me know ok) Please pass this on to other videos! (This comment is not mine. I found it on another video and wanted to spread it) 
Jesus loves you and He just want to take care of you.

comment:
COVIDNINETEEN VACINATIONS, THE 1ST STEP TOWARDS THE MARK OF THE BEAST IS HERE SOON. A great and formidable enemy seeks to enter into the very blood of My children through the altering of your DNA. Because of the curse that came about after the fall of the first man Adam, I came to make a way for you. You are renewed and made clean again by your belief and salvation in Me, your King and Messiah, sent by My Father to redeem you by My blood sacrifice on the Cross of Calvary. Only through Me, the Door, corruptible is made incorruptible, unredeemable made redeemable. I have ransomed you in order to bring creation back to its Creator. Creator YHWH was made flesh to overcome death, hell, and the grave, and to take what was tainted and impure and make it whole again.
The spiritual battle that is raging now is ultimately to strip you of the Divine image of Myself that has been placed within the DNA of My creation. Ask Me for more wisdom and revelation about this and it will be given to you. The veil was torn, access granted when I shed My blood, died and rose again. We have created you in Our image, and when you walk in holiness, righteousness and purity, obeying My commandments, I am enthroned on your heart. You are then transformed in body, soul and spirit. When this transformation occurs, the very frequency of your cells then resonates with Me and raises you closer to your Creator and further away from the lower realm and lower frequencies which keep you bound. This is by design, and when indwelled, My Holy Spirit will be the gatekeeper of your heart, and your entire being, My sanctuary, and the place where I reside in you. When this occurs, My Kingdom is on earth, as it is in Heaven. It is then that I am able to provide victory over the curse for you, preserving the Divine design I have placed within your DNA. There are many layers of revelation to know what is coded there and hidden, secrets to be revealed to only those who overcome.
However, if the gates are breached by sin, lack of obedience, compromise, or lukewarmness, the enemy sets up thrones (strongholds) instead of Me, because my laws, My Word have not been written on your hearts. You have a sworn enemy whose utter mission is to destroy you. He will stop at nothing, and as My Word has foretold, the time is here when the greatest of all violence and evil against My people, those made in My image, is taking place. The battle is for the soul, and the battle is about the blood. Satanâ€™s ultimate goal from the beginning was to corrupt the seed, corrupt the blood that carries My blueprint in you, My design for those made in Our image, your DNA.
There is only one way to ensure that My Throne is upon your heart and your eternal destination is sealed, or your soul will be lost forever. Your must be born again. Your heart must be sealed with My blood. You must be quick to repent often and seek holiness above all else. Love what is true and just. Be extremely careful what your eyes see and your ears hear. This is guarding your heart, guarding its gate. It is in sealing these portals to the soul, in commanding the spirit to govern or have mastery over the soul, that you overcome. You will then be prepared for My return, and be protected from the evil one.
If you have not already done so, seal the portals to the enemy now! Confess your sins and repent for the midnight hour is here! Bind the access points that have given satan legal rights within your temples, within your body, mind, soul and spirit. Give satan and all his dark kingdom a certificate of divorce and be free from the bondage, and from all the oppression and possession in your bloodline immediately! Break the curse from your ancestors back to Adam. Cover it all with My blood and command the enemy out of your bloodline, sealing it as well, the gates to your heart, using the authority you have been given through Me. Exercise dominion as a gatekeeper and a son or daughter of the Most High God, taking your positions as heirs to My Kingdom. My Holy Spirit will then have permission to use you for My glory and manifest through you in this crucial hour.
*(Please see the prayers on the right hand side bar and the one titled Increased Demonic Warfare Prayer covers everything He is instructing here)*
This must be done this moment!! This is crucial! Precious moments remain before the implementation of the enemyâ€™s plan to destroy the DNA of My creation, making you forever unredeemable. The Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence and it must be taken by force! Take My Holy Word and dispossess what has had control of your gateways and that of your family line through covenants, oaths, soul trades and agreements made by your ancestors. Do it this moment! In Me you will be made FREE!
The implementation of the plans to alter your DNA and make it programmable by something other than Me, your Creator, are here. I control and govern the DNA I have placed within you, but if you allow man to administer anything within your bodies, that will recode your DNA, I will no longer be the controller. I will no longer recognize you as My creation. You will have become a mixture of something else, an altered form of man and technology, and therefore, not in My image any longer. Do you understand what I am saying? Truly the hour is here when you must prepare to make the choice to remain fully human, infused with My Spirit. The enemy wants nothing more than to deceive you through propaganda, fear and manipulation and cause you to allow either a mark or an implant (vaccine or digital tatoo) into your bodies that will forever separate you from Me. This is your reality right now! You must know what you will choose to do.
When you open doors to the enemy through sin and through your choices in life outside of My ways, the demonic spirits appoint gatekeepers over your heart, your mind, and your soul. Then those spirits invite more, and when no repentance occurs, strongholds occur. The heart of an unregenerate man is wicked and deceitful above all things. But My Word is quick, powerful, and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the dividing apart of your soul and spirit, your joints and marrow, as I discern the thoughts and intentions of your heart. Allow Me to write My laws on your heart and you will know truth at last. You will know what is now directly in front of you and the choices that are here for you and your loved ones. My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge, but it does NOT have to be this way. Allow My glory to penetrate your spirit so that your soul will come under submission. To not allow this, means you will remain in bondage and you will be easily deceived. If I do not dwell in you fully, and your gates have been breached, another will easily influence you and take governance.
My people, I have given you the keys to the Kingdom. Whatever you bind on earth will be bound in Heaven and whatever is loosed on earth will be loosed in Heaven. Bind the strongman, bind the strongholds on your life and be delivered!
The technology for the mark of the beast is here. It is upon you. It will be presented at first to be taken voluntarily, then very soon after, you will not be able to buy, sell or work. Do not wait another moment. Come out of Babylon and make Me King of your heart, the Divine Gatekeeper of your soul.
The evil ones have set in motion their wicked schemes, as it must be so according to My Word. Many, many judgments will occur as I allow them. This is to wake up My church. You must know where you stand in your walk with Me, because in an instant, everything will change, and there will not be another opportunity to choose, because the choice will be made for you. You are either all in, or I am turning you over to your carnal mind and nature. You have the choice My loves, choose life and eternity in Me over eternal death in darkness.The time is now. 
YAHUSHUA, JESUS THE CHRIST.  130

comment:
This is a beautiful song but this video!?!? I donâ€™t think I have ever watched a video that moved me sooo greatly while making me feel stronger and more beautiful just through appreciating the beauty of the women featured in it! â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸
John Legend is a musical genius as we all know! LOL! And he definitely is killing #lifetimePartnerGoals daily on top of being a clearly devoted and loving father to his beautiful daughter and precious son! But the man is obviously a sensitive, compassionate man with an open, loving heart who can see beauty and hear music all around him!! He couldnâ€™t write such accepting, loving, empowering lyrics sooo beautifully that can move people sooo profoundly without having the soul of an artist, the intelligence of a psychotherapist who can see and understand people at their core, and the view of a world from the view of itâ€™s Creator for he sees beauty in places people hide in darkness and strength in moments of weakness! I have sooo much respect and admiration for this man, this artist! â¤ï¸

author: Angelica040526

comment: What a great song. For me this video is about being 'the one'. I don't mean about being the object of desire or the center of someone's attention. These are selfish indulgences at best. I mean this is about being the one who tells the person that you love that you are the person in their life whose attention they have fully and forever. This is about letting them know that in their journey to find someone who loves them, you are a source of that love. I've been married over 20 years now. That message feels new when ever i give it to my beloved, and I know she never gets tired of hearing it, because for her it feels new every time as well. It is the equal/opposite of the need to love one's self. It's about the equally important need of our loved ones to feel loved. It's our obligation to make our loved one's know that. That's what I got out of this song.
author: Mike Shramko

comment:
Im gonna play this at my wedding for my wife then start ballin crying with her.
She kept saying she was ugly the first week I met her because of bullying at work and I played this.
She hugged me and said sorry for being weak, I said don't say sorry for that. Crying because of hurtful words is not weakness.
Saying things to hurt someone is weakness.
I said you're beautiful and don't need this makeup shit- then the music synched up and she looked me in the eyes.
I sang "ohhhhhh, you don't have- to try, dont try, don't tryyyyy, you don't have to try".
She was in awe because she loves singing and I hate singing but I became vulnerable because what I was saying was the truth.

comment:
Sorry but all of you that think that nobody gives a shit about the inside are wrong, I don't know about you, but I see many people here complaining why other people don't care about the inside, the way I see it, there are many people that do care about personalities, but the problem being, instead of looking around them and seeing the other people thinking the same, they keep complaining and running behind people that dont care.

Sure, there will always be superficial people that just care about the outside, but they are just PART of society, not all of us. The problem is, that we, insecure people or people that have been insecure focus too much on the superficial people instead of focusing on people that appreciate personality over physics. I've seen here people talking about taste and yeah they right every person has different taste, but we shouldn't focus on our physical taste but rather on our personal taste. Instead of focusing on finding a person that loves the same movies as you, try to find a person that appreciates the same personality as you do. 

But before starting to look for external love, try to find internal love, start appreciating all parts of you, start loving you and be comfortable around you and when you're finally able to be happy with yourself, then go and find someone that feels happy by your side.
author: Mauricio Eder

comment:
I always get emotional no matter how many times I watch this.
I was always bullied and called gay for respecting women growing up.
My mother was beaten in front of me multiple times as a baby.
She is the most loving mom ever so I hate any abuse towards women.
I have PTSD from it and can never see a boy hurt a woman now, I snap and attack who evers the agressor towards the girl.
This song is what I was always exhuberating in life so it's nice to hear that someone feels the same way.
I'm not mad at the dudes that treated me like shit, I feel bad that they didn't feel enough love to the point that they would'nt know how to treat a woman or a girl.
That they'd then judge me for excelling in a way they couldn't.
They are just sad.

The video of all the women/ girls not feeling pretty probably adds towards everyone feeling emotional.

comment: I've loved this song the first time I heard it. unfortunately, this was my first time seeing the video. John legend made a beautiful song for his wife but this video made me shed tears of joy and sorrow. I've had a horrible childhood from child abuse to foster care to 4 years in prison. Now live alone,own my second vehicle,and work everyday. The one guy who I thought was there for me turned out to be a liar, cheater ,and verbally tells me how fat I am. I've always been skinny and loved it but from being in prison so long, I've gained 40 pounds.ğŸ˜¢ It's hard to deal with that. There are times I force myself to throw up because I don't want to gain any more weight. Long story short, this beautiful video makes me grateful for what I have and makes me feel beautiful even with all the weight gain. Thank you for sharing this song and whom ever thought of this beautiful video, thank you.

comment: Omg. This song makes me cry everytime I listen to it. It's so crazy because I've actually had boyfriends in the past who wouldn't wanna see me without makeup on or without weave in my hair. Who would call me fat or bloated if I gained a few pounds. This is a serious issue in our society. And it's unfortunate. Women are even denied certain jobs based on how they look. This song just reinforces to me that I'm beautiful just being me without any extra things. Women, we are ALL beautiful. And the next time someone has something negative to say about you, in the words of Mary J. Blige, just say "Take me as I am, or have nothing at all."

comment: To all of the hateful people attacking the 'perverse agenda' of homosexuals... You seem to be implying that homosexuality is wrong because lying with someone of the same sex is considered an abomination, though it is never stated exactly why it is so, only that it is such. Heterosexuals have sex all the time, sexualizing women AND men and turning them into explicit exchanges of pleasure and money with no level of companionship or emotional intimacy to speak of. Homosexual relationships are more often than not COMPANIONSHIP AT ITS BEST. Heterosexual relationships, as far as Biblical theory is concerned, are/were geared toward reproduction. The Bible does not uphold the bodies of women, which are so precious, the way it upholds the male agenda. Everyone deserves happiness. Stop attacking what isn't yours to command. If you truly believe in the Lord then you'll let him address the things you feel are sinful, instead of taking it upon yourself to attack others. Homophobia to a discriminatory degree is on the same level as racism, there is no controversy there. You are attacking people for WHO they are instead of the things they've done. They have done nothing to you except offend your eyes, apparently; Really anyone is capable of doing that nowadays. All the shit going on these days and happy gay couples are your trigger? Get right and get a life.

comment: It was quite a bit shocking but in a very positive way to see a video clip with every day people with their flaws and everything. I really have deep respect for the woman who dared to take her bra of and show her scars of surgery. My mom passed away because of breast cancer 6 years ago. My granny had breast cancer too long ago and had a breast amputated (she lived 35 years after that before she passed away of old age and a broken heart a day after my mom passed away). Granny did always made jokes about it. She used to recall being in hospital, her neighbour came to visit and granny just pulled her shirt down. The neighbour said: "Eeehk don't do that!" and my granny said: "What's wrong? There is NOTHING to be seen!" one time we got an ice cream and the waitress said: "How many balls of ice do you want?" and my granny said: "Make it one so I have two again."

author: Mikayla Benson

comment: I liked the concept of the video and appreciated the attempt at diversity. However, the vast majority of the women in this video were portrayed as cis gendered or had traditional female aesthetics. I have mixed feelings about the fact that Youtube didn't have us log in and confirm our age to view this video because of the woman who is a breast cancer survivor. I don't really think the human body should be censored at all, but Youtube often does according to their policies, but in this case they didn't.  I've never seen another woman's full breasts shown in that way without having to log in, does this mean Youtube no longer considers hers to be breasts? Do nipples make breasts? Really? John has a wonderful way of honoring women with his music about them and the experience of love in general. Let us raise the next generation of young men to be so classy and to treat women with such respect!

author: Jasper Redman

comment: I give so much respect to the lady in the middle of the video who took off her bra to display that she got nothing to fear. From what I know, dealing with perilous illness such as breast cancer is not an easy battle. So many women today are still struggling from the aftermath, sometimes they fall into depression. What she did was not merely an act of bravery but also something that corresponds to the main point of this music. That everybody deserves to love and to be loved. Regardless of the condition or situation in which you are in currently.  She is portraying that her personal scars from battling with a horrendous disease is not going to stop her from showing her true self and her right to be embraced.  Man... this is one of the greatest songs I've heard recently. Thanks John Legend for creating something as valuable as this.

comment:
'Cause I want to hear the message that 'all women are beautiful no matter what' from a guy who married a super model with a lot of plastic surgery.

Real sincere.

I love his music but his overall message in this video is conflicting with his... life. I agree with this message but I do not *believe* it coming from him. This is directed at his wife and not average women. Maybe is not his fault but the director's fault. Pandering to women but lacking in substance.

Good song. Good message but conflicts expectations with reality.

But people still forget that many of these artists went years struggling just to make it... until their work paid off and awesome people gave them a chance. But they kept grinding no matter what! John is like this for sure!! That's the mentality that I share in my music. If you are one of those cool people to give a nobody a chance, stop on by my channel. I promise I have been putting in work and I might surprise you. Either way, always show love to the music and have a good one! Peace.
author: Caleb Hart

comment:
Dear Princess. 
im sitting here thinking about you. I miss you. I want to say thank you for being the amazing person you are to me. I know I say it all the time,but baby I love you. Youve shown me what it is to love and given me reason to wake up everyday. I look forward to everyday because of you. Because everyday is one day closer to me spending the rest of my life with you. I love your perfect little smile and the way your eyes twinkle when you do. the dark brown colour of your eyes that see right through me each and every time you look my direction. to the way your smell hangs on to my clothing after every hug. have I told you that you're beautiful lately? forgive me if ive missed a day I  sometimes take for granted the fact that you already know. hey Farz... those little moments we spend together doing nothing specific? 
they mean the world to me. remember when I said im going to make the happiest person alive?
I meant it.
author: Fransbin Hosh

comment: Very true in so many ways and its a shame that in this day in age all the hatred, judgment, cruelty, racism, cultural differences, I can go on and on , is getting worse each and everyday. My advice don't let Anyone dictate how You choose to live your life. Use their negativity to Empower You and with each negative event that may cross your path use each one to Build Yourself a step to wherever You are going. They think they are hurting you but in actuality they are helping you achieve and get closer to your goals!!!! My heart goes out to Everyone who has gone through this, knows somebody who has gone through this and for the unfortunate who may at one point go through this. I wrote this because I an one of those who has experienced this myself and much more and also know very many people who have experienced this. STAY STRONG!!!!!! NO WEAPON FORMED AGAINST ME SHALL PROSPER!!!

author: M Williams

comment: I doubt you have the time to read the messages here, Mr. Legend, but I am a 60-year-old transgender woman and an activist fighting like hell so Trans people like me can finally have the same rights as others. So many of us are struggling on the streets, too many of us are making the kinds of choices no one should ever have to make, and too many times the struggle to be visible ends in violence . . . but for a few moments tonight, I listened to your song and watched your video . . . a few times actually. I had never seen it before just now. It's 2:20 a.m. . . . All around this country, Trans activists are giving up their weekends and whatever free time they have to develop strategies that will convince our local, state and national elected leaders, our families, our local police, our bosses, classmates, co-workers and anyone else who will listen to look our way and understand that we need them to see us, accept us, and respect us. Your song reminded me that even though many of us live alone and in fear, we have allies who risk an awful lot to make sure we know we are loved  . . . and for that, I am grateful. We cannot climb the mountain that is before us without someone taking our hand and pulling us upward. ~ Char
author: Charin Davenport

comment: This song is how I feel about my boyfriend... He's so perfect. I'm so in love with him... He's the only one in the whole world I want. I'm going to marry that man & spend the rest of my life with him. He has his moments where he's self conscious & I just wish he could see himself through my eyes so he'd know how beautiful he is. He's the most beautiful person on earth to me, inside & out. It doesn't even matter what he looks like. I'm in love with him for who he is and I will find him attractive if he gains weight or becomes disabled or... Anything. Love is blind. Looks are secondary. You cannot truly love someone just for how they look. That is lust. You love someone for the person they are. You fall in love with their mind. All my life I thought I knew what love was until I met him & it's more than I've ever imagined it being. It is the most profound and wonderful thing that has ever happened.

comment: I've always liked this song. But this is my first time seeing the video. It is magnificently diversified. Maybe I'm "preaching to the choir", but equally to all the fellas and ladies; just by watching this it goes to show you that no matter our natural inhibitions, mental handicaps, or physical disfigurations there will be a few people, or maybe ending up being that one particular person that will unconditionally and thoroughly care for you genuinely and infinitely. Even though we try so hard to adapt to this reckless, inconsiderate, bloodthirsty, and self-destructive world; we have to start with ourselves to initiate U-N-I-T-Y and stop acting like tough guys inflicting harm and maledictions on each other.

comment: This song makes me cry because its so moving. No matter what imperfects we have as women, we should embrace them. We don't need make up or extra things to make us beautiful. I always bring myself down but when watching this it bring my spirits up and shows me I am not the only one with imperfections. No matter who we are, we will never be perfect in anyone else's eyes except our creators. Gay, lesbian, trans, bi, straight, fat, skinny, curvy, short, tall no matter whatÂ  we are. We are all women of god and we shouldn't worry about the bad, we should embrace the good in all of us. This is why I love john legend, his songs aren't about drugs or using women, he wants to better the way women are looked at and showing men that its not about the booty or boobs, and that girls shouldn't choose men that look for that. They should look for men or women to love them for who they are and what they bring to the relationship not their body

I must admit I was so engaged by this song and when IÂ view the video clip for this song, I get aÂ bit teary asÂ I understand how it feel to be doubting yourselfÂ  all the time about your looks. It has taken me so long to be comfortable with myself and the way I look.Â Sometimes we don't realize thatÂ we are all beautiful in our own unique way, be it our eyes, hair, lips, nose, ears .....and sometimes we are our worse critics too. I learned to love myself and I see beauty in me thatÂ I thought was ugly.Â To all the girlsÂ out there,Â Â just rememberÂ beauty comes from the inside of your heart.

comment:
I was lost in a world of darkness... blind without knowing my path, I kept hitting walls that pushed me back, the pain struck strong... and when I was about to give up, I saw the glare of a flashlight at the end, and even if I had to deal with an evil witch on my way and demons on my way... I've found the man that showed me true love, kindness, hope, friendship... happiness... he keeps holding the flashlight even when I want to drop it and run back...
Thank you, my wonderful husbando, you've showed me the way and you keep standing by my side even it it's hard... You showed me the meaning of Love and Happiness... I have loved you since I've met you, until now, and forever I will, because in this world, it's only you and I.
You dedicated this song to me and told me to listen to it carefully... I loved it :)

comment: This song makes me feel like an ass. I call people ugly, about 90% of the time, and I don't even know what the hell they're going through. I really want to be a better person because of this song. Is it sad that my first thought when that woman with the deformed breast came on the screen was,"Ew." I had to pause the video and look at myself in the mirror. All the scars I have on my own body, the way my bones jut out awkwardly, I have no right to call anyone ugly. I can't promise that it won't happen again, but I swear, on my mother's grave, that I will try harder to not be an asshole towards people.

comment: I asked my boyfriend one night what song he thought was our song. Im like that. I want to have a song. A quote. A book. Something i can look at or listen to when i miss him. He told me to look this song up. At first i wonder why he would want this one to be it. I asked him. His reply was " I picked this song because i know you dont see yourself at beautiful or sexy. You wont believe me when i tell you that you are beautiful and amazinly sexy. I want this to be our song so when your dont feel beautiful you can listen to these lyrics and realize....ill always love you no matter what you look like. No Matter what happens. Ill love you...."   Well i cried like a baby and called him a dork. But i knew from right then....i wasnt alone anymore. I would always have him there. Beside me. This song is amazing. Thank you

author: Carlos Castro

comment: Im a realist. A realist speaks the truth. The only way to progress is to be honest with the truth. Humans are lazy and selfish. There are many women who are overweight in America. This is mostly due to poor exercise habits and poor eating habits but genes and thyroid problems, etc. also contribute to obesity. Women don't worry about being fat until they get a funny look or somebody says something mean. This causes insecurity. Many women go back to food for short term comfort. In most cases I would bet that the leading factor in young women deciding to make a change in their health is because of insecurity embedded into them by experiences in a society that promotes "thin is beautiful". I believe that if there were no criticism of obese women then we would have many more obese women. My point is that it is sad that the only reasons that young women want to change is more because they want to be accepted into society and less because it is good for your health. So the reason girls decide to change their lifestyle is for a shallow selfish reason. I personally find it incredible how weak-minded we can be having soooooooooooooo many capabilities in this world. Just because others around you hold themselves to a certain standard does not mean that you should do the same, we are wayyyy more capable than what we believe ourselves to be.

comment: I don't understand why most people are saying the video is nasty. There is nothing nasty about it he is just trying to show girls to Â be in love with themselves and how they look. Most of those girls had conditions that they were born with and they have to live with it so he is making this video to show girls they are perfect just the way they are. It's amazing how most people are saying the rude stuff they say but probably are the same ones who run and put make-up on just to take a selfie. Us young ladies and Women have to understand that you can't depend on what a man says about you or what others say. We are very emotional creatures we go through a lot but if we don't learn to love and live what god has created us with than we will always be miserable and depend on what everyone does. Yes, this is a love song and he is basically talking about his wife but he also giving a message to women don't go out the way so much just to look good for someone. We have Flaws And All. We Have To Love It.

comment: I read all these comments, and all I can do is laugh. Life is way too short to be worrying about what people think about you.... Everyone is perfect in God's image  (if your atheist...well... Lol) Yes obesity is bad, and nobody like excessive weight. And yes, here is a limit of trying to be too perfect. I see all these Pple explaining their opinions about how they think the world works.... Theres never been instructions that fell from heaven that tells us how we are suppose to live life. The beauty is we all get to experience together.... And no, the Bible is not instructions, as people have different religions. Well, there's my two cents of wisdom, hope I get a dollar back!

comment:
I'm seriously happy for Laverne Cox. You can say what you want but I do believe the message within the song is beautiful and can not only be applied to women, but also to men, transgenders, gays, lesbians, bisexuals and pretty much everyone who needs a word of support.

I don't understand how people can live their lives looking for the negative sides of every little single thing they see or hear. I you don't agree with the idea of the song, there's no reason to be rude about it. If you think fat/chubby girls are not attractive, then it's your call and it's okay (same goes for those who won't find a skinny girl attractive).

Stop trying to change everyone into your own limited way of thinking and just live your damn life. Stop looking or hearing things you don't like even if others do enjoy it. Comment all you want about how wrong I am or how stupid my ideas may seem. Honestly, all I care is if some can actually relate to this comment. If it's not the case, then it's fine. Everyone has their opinion.

I'm sorry if I made any grammatical mistake. English is not my first language and grammar and I don't really get along...

comment:
To guys saying that girls get all the special treatment and stuff, fudge you guys you don't know what girls feel. A really long time ago, girls were treated as slaves and useless people while guys were treated as actual human beings. Obviously, that doesn't happen anymore but this still kinda happens. No offense but I think girls suffer more than guys because we are always forced to look attractive all the time. Oh and we also experience period and childbirth which is the worst thing about being a girl. This might sound pretty useless but being called ugly just because you're not wearing makeup hurts a lot. And girls are usually raped, abused, and sexually harassed. Those things happens rarely to a guy but it happens all the time if you are a girl. Btw, why are you guys (not all) so mad about girls? We don't say mean stuff to guys so don't do the same to us.
Sorry for the long comment and I'm ready to receive hate replies from guys.

comment:
Men: "But where is the song for the men? I want to be valued too."
Me: Boo fucking hoo.
Let's begin with the fact that many music videos are FOR men. They hyper-sexualize women and focus around tmen being dominant no matter what; whether it is in wealth, work, or relationship. Let the women have this one. It is such a positive message for everyone, and it can benefit you men as well, just look at it from different perspectives. Try to see how uplifting this could be for some women who don't find themselves worthy or attractive. Men say they want confidence in a woman, that it is "sexy." author: Andrea Diaz

comment:
To Danny Villasana,, Jesse Williams, "John McClane" and other commenters on this video (I'm going to assume you're open enough to discussion to read all of this):
Before any of you say that we don't need videos like this, that the message is wrong, that X or Y people can't be attractive or that we owe you being attractive, I sincerely beg you to consider this.
While there ARE standards of attractiveness for men, women are the ones expected to take diets (sometimes even from ages as early as 12 or under), to put on make-up, to dress provocatively (but not TOO provocatively, because it's then HER fault when men aren't capable of basic control, apparently). We are taught to suffer and bleed for beauty. Yet, as you can see in representations of the typical average family in media such as The Simpsons, you are allowed to be fat, to not take care that much of your physical appearance, and still have a wife who loves you no matter what.
We don't have such freedom, since people can openly and constantly criticize us if we don't fit your very specific and unrealistic criteria. Both men AND women, because women are taught that a GREAT portion of our worth comes from our physical attractiveness; no matter what we're doing or where we are there will always be a comment about our appearance, even if we're working in NASA or running for the Olympics. Even little girls learn to become self-conscious about their appearance, and that's NOT healthy.Â And that's not even beginning to mention stuff like race or gender identity.
Beauty, however, is in the eye of the beholder, and beauty standards were VERY different in other time periods; they are NOT universal. Did you know fat women used to be preferred to skinny women, since it meant more wealth and ability to bear children?
Did you know you can be fat AND healthy? Did you know you can be naturally big or skinny, and that trying to change that can destroy your health? Did you know there are women of all different body types and face structures, with different styles, tastes and orientations, just like with you?.
We need videos like this because of men like you. We don't owe you anything.
(keep in mind that I'm not trying to undermine self-conscious men; I understand men can still be judged by their appearance)
author: Danae O.

comment: I wish if they also included in this video a Muslim woman wearing a headscarf. I say this because as a Muslim Arab woman who wears the headscarf, people often Â looks at me or treat me different, some are very judgmental even if they don't say it or show, I can feel it. I lived in the West/US for sometime and I still chose wore my scarf(hijab), if I got a coin for every time people ask me why i'm wearing it although I live alone, or I should take it off because "no one" can see me, I would be rich by now. Problem is that some are judgemntal because they think that women who wears a scarf are "oppressed", whereas what i think is even in other societies if you got to wear certain clothes to impress others due to society pressure, you're also oppressed. In the end, scarf or no scarf, clothes is not what makes us who we are, it's us who we want to be, and how we want others to perceive us.Â

comment: This is stunning. Absolutely stellar. I found the link through Tumblr and watched the entire video through, and I am so glad I did. I am bawling so hard right now! The message behind this is so beautiful, and so rare to find nowadays, especially from an artist as popular as John Legend. Beauty comes in all forms, and all different shapes and sizes... Society would not have us see it that way. Every single woman in this video was stunningly beautiful... not only in appearance, but in smile and in confidence. To have the bravery to do a video like this when society's expectations are what they are is amazing, and I greatly admire every single one of them. There are always the ignorant, who insist that anything outside of societal norm is unappealing... but they are just that... ignorant. Confidence and comfort in one's own skin is an amazing feat to achieve, and I truly believe that beautiful messages like this video being shown in popular media is just what society needs. A truly amazing song, an even more amazing video, and truly beautiful and extraordinary women. Thank you for this <3

comment: I just read this comment and all of its replies: "Why would a transgender person be in a video about women? EVERYONE thinks you should support the LGBT community and I do but this video is for women not men who want to be women. " Â and more or less youtube responded in Laverne Cox's defence, and while I'm glad they did, Â they failed to really address or answer this "Cam" individuals comments appropriately, ignorantly focusing more on what makes or defines or classifies an individuals gender. Unnecessary. First of all - Did you write this song? Did you conceptualize this video? Were you apart of the production team? Is your name John Legend? No? Then I'm severely confused... Because if you had nothing to do with conception and or creation of this project, then who are you to definitively dictate "Who" this video is for and more specifically "Who" this video is not for? John Legend and Co. wrote this song, conceptualized the video and purposefully chose to incorporate each and every single soul you see represented in this video. Â Not you or anyone other youtuber with an "opinion", and thus this video is for everyone represented in it. Make sense. Awesome. FYI in the future when stating an opinion or question, simply do just that, state your opinion or question i.e. "this video is for women not men who want to be women" is not an opinion but rather a definitive statement that falsely, arrogantly and ignorantly attempts to dictate the artistic and love expression that foundations the true intention behind this video, an intent you did not conceptualize or manifest in this first place. I digress. @johnlegendVEVOÂ Thank you for this beautiful expression of Love. It truly blesses and ignites my soul every time I watch it! Be blessed, and have a phenomenal day. Love, Hope, Light - Azabella

comment: *rolls eyes* clearly half of these people watching this video don't get the message or the concept. We are all different, if God wanted everyone to be a size 1 we would all possess that look. He is not encouraging obesity, he is simply saying that no matter your race, color or size you are beautiful. Not everyone was built to be a size 2 and I personally think if someone is comfortable in their own skin, who gives us the right to tell them otherwise. "Average" size people die everyday it doesn't mean that if you have some meat on your bones you are automatically unhealthy. We make obese people because we constantly bring them down about the way they look but who are we to judge them. You let them know that they are beautiful no matter what anyone has to say or feel and if they see it fit to change let them make that decision instead of shoving it down their throats.

comment: I think people missed the mark on this video. It's not to encourage negative lifestyles or for you fowl minded fools to continue to judge women on their appearance. You wonder why women have a hard time believing their beautiful? When there are so many people there to break down their self-esteem. Maybe your opinions of transgender, overweight, disabled, scarred, or "ugly" women is irrelevant. They have had their struggles, and instead of giving them 'tough love', why not encourage them to embrace who they are. John Legend always holds women on a pedestal because he values their worth, regardless of their physical appearance. If the world could do that as a whole, maybe this world would be a better place.

comment: This is one of the most powerful music videos I've ever seen. The message for me is that beauty comes in all sorts of packages and is not limited to some package sold to us by the purveyors of high fashion, cosmetics, cosmetic surgery or "standards of beauty". Truly the only standard of beauty is the standard one sets for themselves. Whatever turns you on--whatever makes your heart go spastic with delight--that person is your "nobody in the world". Thank you John Legend for the song and thank you to whoever came up with the concept for this video and directed it.Â

comment: I understand the honest comments on this video. However, I do know men and women that are attracted to bigger women. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. There are too many insecure women in this world and I think this video sends a beautiful message. Though, I do think that a woman needs to feel beautiful to herself first! Sometimes they do need a some help to realize their beauty. I repeat, beauty is in the eye of the beholder. I do not agree with the way some people treat their body or how they are not eating or exercising. The emphasis on THEIR body though. Not mine, I choose to love my body and wish the best for people. With the homophobic comments of Laverne Cox, get over it. She has chosen to be in the spotlight, she is a transgender. Read up on the transgender community and the mental & physical aspects of it. Kudos to her. I understand we all have an opinion. Just make it sound respectable and not disgusting. Kudos to the people that are saying their opinions in a respectable way.Â

comment: I think the overall message of this song is wonderful. Though it's also important to remember that plenty of self-confident, happy, and self-worth acknowledging women put makeup on, wear earrings, etc. It's also important to remember that plenty of women aren't super insecure about their image or self-worth, despite there being many who are. Also, this message isn't telling people that obesity is healthy. It's telling people that no matter what, they don't deserve to be shamed for their appearance and that they are still beautiful. That's a subtle but big difference.Â

comment: The comments on this video make me so sad. I was hoping to scroll down and see people feeling as wonderful as I did after watching, but apparently the world is just too judgemental, uneducated, uncaring and prejudiced to even begin to understand. Wake up and realise it's not all about you and what you're comfortable with, that people's bodies are their own and you cannot pass judgement or police them because of your own feelings of uncomfort. Wake up and realise that the world doesn't exist in binaries but in a spectrum of never-ending proportions. Wake up and realise that people have the right to feel beautiful and right in their own skin, however much they had to change to get there and however much they didn't. And they are beautiful. All of them.
author: All That We Shall Be

comment: I lost my shit at 2:44- I can't believe with the power of the message portrayed here is, how sensitive every woman (No matter what age, race, gender identity, sexual preference, weight, or economic class) is about her looks, that the men below me can only comment on fat people being unattractive or whether or not some woman is really a man. The painful truth that you all don't want to face is that it's people like YOU (Jesse Williams!) that are the reason every woman looks in the mirror and question themselves. You know what, plenty of people could argue that they find a woman without a breast unattractive too, but who would be so heartless to point that out. Everyone's body is different. You MISSED the message here. If you're that shallow then there's no way I can see for you ever understand empathy, compassion, or love.Â

comment:
I want to see somebody make a montage video of MEN and BOYS feeling insecure, because women aren't the only ones! I've seen too many of these videos with girls feeling insecure/sorry for themselves (this one, Colbie Caillat's Try, Miley Cyrus' 7 Things), when somebody should really make one with guys doing the things that guys do to be beautiful.
Most of my friends are boys, and I see firsthand how they try really hard to be gorgeous for girls and for everybody else. They worry as much as girls do about their appearance.
Also, women shouldn't need to be told they're beautiful all the time. One of my best friends told me that she thinks the most wonderful thing that a girl can be called is "smart," not "beautiful."

comment: All of the negativity on here. It's making a point that everyone should look at people as beautiful.  My wife was a size 8 when we got married 17 years ago and has gained some weight after having 3 kids, although she's tried she can't lose weight after being put on some medications for migraines and other problems. comment: People at my school were picking on my girlfriend. Telling her she was ugly. I had never seen her so sad. I had pre-made plans one night, but they got cancelled. She didn't know that. I snuck over to her house with a note and some flowers, plus a guitar. Rang her doorbell and she was the one that answered. I sang this songÂ to her, and I never sing. Her smile made everything perfect. I got to see her beautiful smile all night. She is the most beautiful girl in the world to me. You should always go out of your way to make sure you're girlfriend knows she's beautiful...

comment: I learned when I was about 8 or 9 yrs old that beauty is within! Â And as I grew up I had my step daughter at Shriners Children Hospital when it was still in S.F. CA. there was a young girl maybe 15 or 16 that played with matches when she was 3 yrs. Her body was 87% burned from head to toes. She was going thru skin grafs and her boyfriend came from Kansas to ask her to the Senior Ball! She is such a beautiful young lady inside and out. She asked me why would he want to take me? She said that she is so ugly, I explained my Older Sister married her Husband even after he contracted rabies and was disfigured and both leggs amputated and she was still deeply in love with him, 37 years later. And was at his bedside when he passed away just this year R.i.p. Â Long story short. Â Beauty is within your heart and the way a person carries themselves. Ugly people are those ignorant people who call others ugly.Â

At the end of the day, this is a song about love :)

comment:
Wow. 'If guys can show their nipples, why can't we?' That is the most pathetic thing I have ever read. Do you guys really think that this whole bullshit 'free the nipple' campaign is about sexism and gender politics? Uh, yeah, no. More like self-aggrandisation and exhibitionism.

The female breast will always be freighted with more sexual associations than the male breast. Who's fault is this? Women explicitly attempt to make their breasts more predominate so as to appear more sexually attractive to men. Breasts are not just a sign of femininity, but a sign of sexual maturity. How do you expect men and growing boys to have respect for women? Have you now realised how ridiculous you sound? This nonsense masquerading as a meaningful political cause is just an excuse for certain women to be exhibitionists.

comment: I'm so sick of seeing girls caked up to look like barbies. It is refreshing to see the women of the world AS THEY ARE and STILL call them beautiful and STILL tell them they are loved. Yes they may have grown old, yes they get picked on at school because they have a deficiency, yes they have skin disorders and deformities and don't meet society's standards or "beautiful" but THEY EXIST despite the world trying to hide them or ignore them and they are JUST as beautiful. So WHAT if you saw a woman who had to surgically remove her breast due to a TUMOR being in it! You think SHE wants to look at it?! She keeps thinking she's ugly and disgusting and no longer a worthy human being so who are YOU who doesn't know her struggle to say SHE'S RIGHT?! Focus on them message more than your own preference for a pleasant image or perfect barbie that you spoiled bitches are used to! GOD I'm so SICK of the ignorant!

comment: See, ladies, the way I see it, you CAN wear makeup and spend time and money buying clothes, materialistic goods, even PLASTIC SURGERY if YOU really wanted to. See that's the catch - we have it engrained in our mind that if we try to improve our exterior, we must be doing it for SOMEBODY ELSE. That is not ALWAYS the case. Sure, there are insecure girls who believe they are not pretty enough for him/her, but some girls (and guys!) try to improve their looks to improve their mentality. So I guess what I'm trying to say is that, yes, this message holds true for some, but others just use makeup, clothes, jewellery to make themselves feel good and confident and powerful :) Men also have to keep remembering that women try not for the men, but for themselves.

comment: Funny, this song is all about women wanting society (particularly men) to realize the beauty of a woman should not be determined by superficial or materialistic factors, yet many, many women choose only to be in a relationship with a man due to his financial status and/or things that he owns. How often do you see a 10/10 woman with an overweight or unattractive man? That's right, almost NEVER. Unless of course he is the owner of a multimillion dollar business or famous. Where are all the songs telling women to not only look at men for what they have. That's right, THERE ISN'T ANY. No musician would ever produce a song telling women to look on the inside of a man as opposed to what he has financially because of the uproar it would cause in today's society and how it promotes the degradation of women. This is yet ANOTHER piece of media proclaiming the greatly exaggerated (at times non existent) mistreatment of women in today's society.

comment: Best music video I have ever seen. Personally, I thought the song itself was terrible but the message was amazing and I can't express my love for this video. It included WoC, disabled people, trans people, gay people, people who look physically fine but represent the mental insecurities, people of every age and cancer patients. It doesn't exclude anyone and I just really needed this. You don't see much positive representation of people who don't fit societies norm in media, so I'm so grateful to John for this - thank you so fucking much.

author: merlin

comment: The comments whether or not the women in the video are "pretty,' "good looking,' downrighht unattractive? Don't you understand John Legend's theme that driving this song, whether you like the song or not? Â THe message is more important than the damn song pro or con. And it's not only applicable to women be they transgendered, white, a woman who has undergone a mastectomy; the message is very clear (at least to those who understand the issues of self-esteem and body image, female and male, to reinforce the beauty of the inner being. Having survived a severe eating disorder of 29 years, and after several hundred thousands of dollars spent to save my life, this is a song of reinforcement for me personally. And it's my responsibility as a male, 14 years in recovery from that damn eating disorder, to publicly speak out and to dispel these ridiculous comments. WHen a human being is "shamed" for not being what the Kardashian clan and the fashion media are dictating, living with all of that unnecessary shame is absolutely life threatening. On a final note, had any one read the purpose behind Legend's composition or was it just easier to bitch it out here.

comment:
It'd be nice if we could all stop measuring self worth based on whether or not someone believes you are "beautiful" to them. As a species, we've progressed so far that it's about damn time we judged each other's worth about what comes from our mouths, the information in our heads, and how much we contribute from the heart. I really don't care if you tell me how "pretty" I am because I've gone through too much in my life and learned too many lessons for you to only notice if I am physically appealing or not.

Stop telling women (and men) they're beautiful when they're so much more than that.

comment: Every day I see extremely handsome guys dating overweight women when they could charm a woman who is fitter and corresponds to society's view on beauty. ln your shallow perspective maybe looks are all that matter. At first it might even be the sole element a person can grasp when they look at someone but later on that victoria's secret model might open her mouth and completely destroy the attractiveness she conveyed through her image while the obese woman, while not seeming beautiful at first might open hers and make a man think twice about his first impression of her. In terms of sex, maybe the victorias secret one would always be chosen when taking into account her exterior beauty. However, in a relationship just sex wouldn't cut it. She would have to be much more than a barbie to make something the cut for a prosperous relationship. And thats where less attractive women may come in and offer more substance than fitter ones. Not to say that "attractive" women can't have both interior and exterior beauty (the beauty society/media imposes) but when it comes down to one or the other a  man looking for a life long partner will always choose interior beauty.

comment: our skin plays a key role in how we feel about ourselves from the inside and by simply saying we should feel good about ourselves from only within and the outside shouldn't and doesn't matter, would be a superficial statement filled with ignorant emotions that we avoid to confront. We can only feel good from within if first we learn to accept what we look like from the outside. Everyone is different and go through a million changes over the course of life. However, the way the world interacts we never seems to understand nor think of all these other issues such as bullying, racial and cultural norms (several other experiences) and they way social media seems to interact when something looks appealing compared to another that people perceive and suggest to be "ugly" or "unpleasing" to the eye. This may be a lot to take in and I can be wrong as well, to which i leave the world to decide. However, this perception has been ideal to help me perceive others as equally beautiful and that beauty is something that is woven in everyone, if you chose to view others in such a way.Â

author: bbnative ajani

comment: I came here to post about how much I love this song and I saw this really disrespectful and negative comment about "fat people" by I believe his name was Jesse Williams but I couldn't find the comment anymore. If you are him and you can see this post I hope and pray that you get the help that you clearly need sir.Â  Your comment was totally rude and un called for.Â  You think it's bad for people to be fat and that what did you say something like "fat people are unattractive" well I have to disagree with you on that one.Â  My best friend was a plus sized woman. She was beautiful not only on the inside but on the outside as well.Â  She was such a great person, she loved everyone and everyone loved her.Â  She was the nicest most genuine person I've ever met and I was so blessed to have her in my life for 35 years.Â  She was such a nice and sweet person but however there were people out there LIKE YOU who could only see the outside appearance and not even try to see the inside.Â  She may have been strong and loving but she was a human being WHO HAD FEELINGS and sometimes things got to her. She made up in her mind that she was going to start working out and even though she lost a noticeable amount of weight there were still JERKS like you out there picking on her and making rude comments just to hurt her so she finally couldn't stand it and went to have surgery. She died on the table!Â  Something went wrong and she died.Â  My best friend died because she was tired of ASSHOLES like you making fun of her and she thought she'd be more accepted if she looked the way society thinks beautiful women should look.Â  I'll never see her again, her 3 year old daughter will never see her again, he mother and father will never see her again. We'll never see her smile again or hear her laugh so hard that she snorts all because of STUPID jerks like you who think that just because a woman isn't a size 0 she's unattractive.Â  Well I have news for you sir, everybody on this earth is beautiful and just because YOU may have an opinion about something doesn't mean that you need to voice it.Â  Haven't you heard the saying :If you don't have anything nice to say don't say anything at all?"Â  You should really practice that.Â  There are many beautiful PLUS SIZED people out in this world and they all have feelings! You don't know how a person thinks they may be one step away from doing something that could put them in danger or get them killed. You could say something rude to someone and that one rude comment could make them kill themselves....Â  Do you really want that on your conscience? Remember that the next time you want to voice an opinion. JERK!Â  Rest In Peace Andrea Marie Smith. You were my best friend and I will love you forever. You may be gone but you will never ever ever be forgotten!

author: SaminSays

comment:
Hello, your friendly neighborhood youtube commenter here on this specific video "You & I"!
(â—¡â€¿â—¡âœ¿)

Please avoid dwelling on the negative, transphobic, misogynistic, racist, ignorant, fatphobic or ableist comments you might find down here in the youtube comment section of the video, because some people are profoundly sad, lonely and/or deathly afraid of things they don't understand!

Or if you want to understand, take take to educate yourself, and the internet is a bountiful place for growing your knowledge and awareness! Don't be afraid.Â 
Â 
Just wanting to wish everyone on this video a good day and allow yourselves to feel loved and special in someone's eyes. And if not for another, than for yourself!

It is important to note:
The song may be very commercialized and profits off of "you don't know you're beautiful until I tell you" sort of thing. That is a thing to be acutely aware of, especially if you are female-identified!
And some women and femmes don't necessarily prepare themselves aesthetically for anyone, but do it to feel good and enjoy the art of self care!

But it is also very intimate and loving and recounts John Legend's feelings towards his wife, Crissy Teigan in a very pure and and sincere way at this time! That is very special!

Also it is a good chance to inspect ourselves for what we find internally beautiful and precious in others and ourselves, even though human flesh is temporary, and even human memory and vivacious human life is even more temporary.Â 

You are loved very much,
#FriendlyNeighborhoodYoutubeCommenter.Â (â—¡â€¿â—¡âœ¿)

comment:
I find it sad that on a song about love that their is so much hate spewed about it. Some may not like that John Legend is not with a black woman, but it is his life not ours, so enjoy your same race or interracial relationship (or lack thereof). Some may not like the lesbian aspect of the video, but it's their life so enjoy your heterosexual life. Some may not like the transgender woman aspect but it's her (or his, whichever you prefer to believe, she identifies as a woman so I will address her as such) life, enjoy your chosen or God-given reproductive organ. Let us all just agree that this is a beautifully written and executed song. Kudos to John Legend! And onÂ a personal side; "SOPHIA!! :)"

Please do not send hate my way, I'm just a lover of music and all people. Whether you reciprocate the feelings or not will have no effect on my daily life. GOD loves us all no matter what we do or believe, therefore I feel we should all do the same. Peace and Blessings to each of you.

comment: This is the most beautiful, inspiring music video I've probably ever seen! You can't help what you look like, what figure you have, the color of your skin, the way past injuries, cancers, or birth defects can change your appearance dramatically. Everyone needs to be different, if everyone was stick thin, had perfect skin, etc. you wouldn't be able to tell anyone apart... My point-everyone is gorgeous in their own different way and this video shows all types of people and their beauty. That to me is inspiring.

everyone is besides the point! If any men or women! Have issues with self esteem or self image! W.e it may be! comment:
I knew I shouldn't have read the comments....

Jesus, women can't have ONE thing without men pissing and whining 'WHAT ABOUT MEEEEE" can they? Yea, so what? What about you? Maybe there will be a song about you someday, but this one isn't about you. It's about women everywhere, so stop fucking crying about it. Straight white men are literally catered to their entire lives. You get the best jobs, you get paid better, you get treated better, you don't have to walk around at night thinking "gee, I sure hope somebody doesn't rape me as I'm walking down this alleyway!"Â 

I'm just so fucking sick of it. Just shut the fuck up. You literally own the entire planet, let women have ONE music video, You think that just because you aren't included in ONE thing means you are being done wrong, that it's "sexist" or some bullshit. Well newsflash fellas NOT EVERYTHING IS ABOUT YOU!!!!!

comment: A lot of people in the comments are saying that the message is that all women are beautiful. What's so great about beauty? Why is it that *women* are the only ones who need to be told they're beautiful? Stop measuring a whole demographic by physical traits. Women are people, and people are special in areas other than attractiveness. Da Vinci, Hawking, Blackwell, Ochoa, Curie, Tereshkova, Einstein-- none of them were supermodels. Let go of *pretty* and focus on being the best person you can be. That's all that counts when you're dead and gone.Â

comment: IÂ love this music video. I think it accurately shows some of the hardships women struggle with everyday. In a society which oftenÂ glorifies appearance over moral character, women who aren't blessed with the perfect face or hair feel cornered and unworthy in comparison to women who are. It sucks thinking that you aren't good enough because of something that is completely out of your control. and of course there are men who get upset over this sort of thing (patriarchy at it's finest). I'm not trying to say that men don't also experience some of the same struggles women do, but can you at least be fucking empathetic? Women have it hard! there isÂ no denying that. We are finally, but slowly, moving forward in this world as intellectual and completely and equally capable beings. We are just starting to be seen as powerful creatures rather than house keepers and trophies for men to carry around and show off. There are good men in the world, but we all know there are some terribly awful men too, that put women down and demean them in order to maintain control; and if a song and a music video inspires those women and shows them that they are not alone and that they are so much stronger than they actually believe, then who gives a fuck! its a beautiful video that shows that all women have the capability and potential to have a happy life and achieve everything they dream for regardless of the way the look, the struggles they have gone through, and the circumstances they come from. it shows thatÂ we shouldn't be shamed for being ourselves and that we are all worthy of the life that we want.

comment: What I want to point out to everyone saying negative thngs is that OF COURSE the most beautiful girl in the video is his wife. THAT'S THE POINT. He loves her, and he sees her as the most beautiful woman in the world, whether she is or not. The point is that anyone who loves you thinks you're beautiful. It doesn't matter if she is a model or a boxer or a cancer survivor or anything else. To him, through his eyes, she's the most beautiful girl in the world. How else would he portray, through a visual medium, that she is the most beautiful to him, than by using the most objectively beautiful girl?

comment: I feel this song is beautiful and is not really promoting feminism, but letting all the women out there know that they are beautiful the way they are. Many men can say they don't care, but I've seen how men react to the way women look. I've seen & been through the hell. Not everyone thinks like those who still have their self-esteem. Not everyone is as strong. It's hard as hell to pick your esteem up after being insulted over and over and over again by multiple people. And for some people, music is their rock. Their stability. What keeps them breathing and from taking their lives. So I believe that artists should make songs like this more often. Just because this song doesn't help you doesn't mean it didn't change someone else's life. Never underestimate the power of music & the media.Â

comment: I think John Legend is amazing and I love this song so much. This song is a celebration to women of all types, shapes, sizes, etc. No matter what you may think of yourself, you're beautiful. Women tear themselves down for their tiniest flaws but this song is speaking to those of us who see your "flaws" and just see them as unique personifications of your beauty. As a gay man, I see my girlfriends always doing this to themselves and even those women in my family. This song is perfect because it sings from the heart of love and belief that your flaws are beautiful and without them, you would not be you. Who cares what race is represented more or who specifically shows up in the video, it's the a celebration of women. Btw, John Legend probably asked HER to be part of this video because Trans Females are some of harshest critics on themselves and yet there is nothing wrong with them. This video is for all women to show them that there are men and women who see their beauty through and through.Â
author: Julian Ortega

comment:
This is such a beautiful song & a very powerful video! It shows that everyone on the entire planet, even the most "perfect of perfect", has flaws and insecurities. Men & women, boy & girls, young & old, we all have something we dislike about ourselves, but it just means we're normal. Nothing in the world is wrong with feeling a little down on yourself every once and a while, we all go through hard times but just don't mope around on it for too long and embrace it. Chances are, no one is focusing on it as much as you are! I tell myself that all the time when I feel out of place or just 'he' about myself. 
John, you've done it again. You make such amazing music!

author: daniela medina

comment: Ok let us just make this clear, this was a beautiful song and music video. John Legend, you sir are a true gentleman and I am happy that you are using your power of music to heal others, empower others, and deal with social issues. However, to everyone here complaining here about "Omg men don't understand" or "Omg how come men don't get the same love" or "Omg...etc" it is going to be impossible to be politically correct. You can't express artistic freedom by always being politically correct. To the women who say, "men don't get it", I would say that is a bit of a stretch. There are men out there who are just as broken and feeling as unloved as you are. They are also being told they cant do things by their peers; they aren't just told "hey you were born a guy go ahead and do whatever you want without harassment". With respect to the men who are ignorant enough to say, "hey you females are completely equal and opportunities are exactly the same, stop whining", open your eyes. The reality is that it is true that females aren't yet equal in society or opportunity, but we will work as a society of both men and women to fix it together. In my personal opinion though I do think that more females are physically and emotionally oppressed. Maybe it is just exposure or the amount that speak out, but I do believe in that. That being said, it just simply isn't true that it is a gender selective problem. Guys aren't immune to that crap, no one is. It is a problem in SOCIETY AS A WHOLE. It is a problem with individuals and not a single man or a woman. It happens both ways so instead of pointing fingers in todays world I think we should just take a moment and realize that we aren't that different from one another. If you have a problem, someone might have the same problem. Lets try and make things better for one another. John Legend is just someone who loves and respects his woman and all other women. I would hope she feels the same way back, but the main focus here should be that one individual is loving another individual no matter what. That person has compassion to try and make things better in the lives of those who might be feeling unwanted or unloved. Anyway, thank you John Legend on behalf of all guys and more importantly all people who feel this way.Â  I hope we find comfort and love and share it to those in need. Have a good day YouTube.

comment: I look at some of these comments, and there I easily find the answer as to what is wrong with this world. There is little to no humanity left in it. What happened to basic human decency? Oh that's right it's not being taught to children anymore. Just hand them a damn electronic babysitter, or pay for a real one right?Â  If every parent put as much time into their children as they do themselves these kids would have a fighting chance at a future. One where people care about one another, like they used to. I have a 3 yr old son, and every time someone sneezes whether he knows them or not he says bless you, when the situation arises he says please, he says thank you, he says no thank you, he says excuse me, and all the other polite things well mannered children do. Those little things are basic, and decent. I have my teens do random acts of kindness at least 3 times a yr, as I do myself almost on a daily basis. Because I want them to not only be well mannered, I want them to be good human beings. We are all human, and all know how to be decent to one another. So I ask you, when was the last time you were a decent human being and said something nice to someone you didn't know? Did something for someone other than yourself/family expecting nothing in return? Or took the time to teach your children manners, and what it really means to be a good person?Â

comment: This is hands down the best music video I've Ever seen. The lyrics are simply powerful. I honestly dont know why you men are complaining about how we dont have a song that represents us. What the hell. Weve come along way from giving woman the same equal rights and giving them a chance to be actual people in this world. Men have always been the dominant sex and we should use that to lift women up and make them feel respected. We dont go through have the shit that they do. Giving birth, expected to basically serve yet still look beautiful, work as hard as men do and not get paid the same. Us men, we are told that we can do whatever we desire, as for women.. They have to work twice as hard to even get recognized. In this video i see women concerned about their looks because thats what society intends. That shouldnt be the case. Women have more to them than just their Beauty. This is why everyday i will try to make my mother, sister and girlfriend feel not only beautiful, but also respected and vauable. I suggest the rest of you men do the same. Cheers.

author: gaewww

comment:
Beautiful video. So many wonderful representations of female strength and beauty.Â 

My *only* concern is that it still ads fuel to the stereotypical fire of female=body/self image link. Please don't misunderstand. I'm not saying women don't have body issues and media pressure from beauty marketing towards "perfection", but I think it's time to step away from seeing women as victims that need to be validated externally. I think true acceptance comes from the inside out. Personally for me, no matter how many times someone, anyone, tells me how good I look, it's not going to change the fact that I don't like things about myself, and that's ok.Â Â
